document.discussion_title: Suspect arrested after pulling knife on Northampton officer | WWLP.com
document.topic_text: Suspect arrested after pulling knife on Northampton officer Alex Lesieur of Springfield charged with disorderly conduct, carrying a dangerous weapon August 11, 2016, 6:11 pm Updated: Click to share on Pinterest (Opens in new window) NORTHAMPTON, Mass. (WWLP) – A Northampton police officer drew his gun in order to get a suspect to drop a knife during a disturbance in a park Tuesday night. That suspect, 31 year-old Alex Lesieur of Springfield, is now being charged with disorderly conduct (subsequent offense) and carrying a dangerous weapon. Northampton Police Capt. John Cartledge told 22News that around 5:10 that night, two bicycle officers at Pulaski Park noticed a disturbance involving six people. Cartledge said that one of the six (later identified as Lesieur) was carrying a knife. Cartledge said that Lesieur turned toward one of the officers while still holding a knife, and walked a short ways toward him. The officer pulled out his gun, and Lesieur promptly dropped the knife. He was then placed under arrest. Share this:
